description:
Application for a Minor Material Amendment (S73a) to vary condition 12 of planning permission ref: P/2008/0156 dated 29/11/2009 (as amended) for Demolition of existing buildings (part of the stable block, the Town Hall Annexe, nos. 2-12 New Broadway, existing Parish Hall and boundary wall to west and south of the church forecourt/car park), and construction of 7 new buildings (ranging from 2 storey to 14 storeys plus enclosed rooftop access) with retention of former fire station and part stable block, to provide maximum of 698 residential units; 9,040sqm retail (Use Class A1/A3), 139sqm office (Use Class B1), 920sqm Health Spa (Use Class D2) and 325sqm community use (Use Class D1), with basement car parking, associated public realm and landscaping and vehicular access off Longfield Avenue and pedestrian accesses from Longfield Avenue, Springbridge Road and New Broadway. 

Minor amendment to condition 12 sought to amend the wording of the condition to remove the requirement for parking spaces provided within the development to be for the exclusive use of occupiers of the development
decision_conditions: The development shall be commenced within 3 years of the decision before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of materials applied to the exterior of the building(s) approved under ref: P/2010/1084 dated 07/10/2010, P/2010/3606 dated 06/10/2010, P/2011/1861 dated 05/07/2011, P/2013/0995 dated 14/06/2013, P/2014/4268 dated 27/10/2014, P/2015/0773 dated 20/04/2015, and 165614CND dated 13/01/2017.

Reason: To provide a high quality satisfactory appearance and robust finish to these large prominent buildings located within the Ealing Town Centre Conservation Area in the interests of the visual amenities of the locality in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'(2004).

| The development shall be completed in accordance with the full detailed drawings of the design and external finishes to the buildings approved under ref: P/2010/1085 dated 07/10/2010, P/2010/3607 dated 07/10/2010, P/2013/1517 dated 14/06/2013, P/2015/1016 dated 20/04/2015, P/2014/3864 dated 16/09/2014, and 164770CND dated 09/11/2016.

Reason: To provide a high quality satisfactory design and appearance to these prominent buildings within the Ealing Town Centre Conservation Area in the interests of the visual amenities of the locality in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.8 and 5.5 of the adopted Council's Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the hard surfaces and levels approved under ref: P/2010/3061 dated 11/07/2011, P/2011/4390 dated 02/03/2012, P/2013/1644 dated 07/06/2013, P/2014/3872 dated 24/09/2014, P/2015/1474 dated 22/05/2015, and 164769CMD dated 07/11/2016.

Reason: To provide a satisfactory finish in the interests of the visual amenities of the locality and in the interests of the residents, pedestrians and other users of these hard surfaced areas in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3, 4.5, 4.8, 5.5, 9.5 and 9.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details species and densities of planting for the areas of soft landscaping approved under ref: P/2008/2156 dated 23/11/2009, P/2010/3062 dated 21/11/2011, P/2014/3873 dated 24/09/2014, P/2015/1673 dated 22/05/2015, and P/2015/1673 dated 22/05/2015. The details approved shall be completed within 3 months of the substantial completion of that part of the development, or such other time as may be agreed by the local planning authority within the phasing programme. Any trees or shrubs which within 5 years of planting die, are removed, or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced within the next planting season with others of the same size and species, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the local planning authority.

Reason: To provide integral planting in the interests of the visual amenity and character of the development and the character and appearance of the locality and the in the interests of the amenities of the occupiers of accommodation within the development, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, 4.8 and 5.5 of the council's adopted Unitary Development Plan' Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the landscape management programme approved under ref: P/2011/3863 dated 25/01/2012, P/2013/1626 dated 20/06/2013, P/2014/3874 dated 24/09/2014 and P/2015/1674 dated 22/05/2015.

Reason: To nurture and protect the new soft landscaping in the interests of the visual amenity and character of the locality  and the amenities of the residents in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the provisions of Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of soil medium approved under ref: P/2010/3063 dated 17/11/2011, P/2013/1643 dated 20/06/2013, P/2014/3876 dated 24/09/2014, and P/2015/1675 dated 22/05/2015.

Reason: To ensure adequate and appropriate growing and drainage conditions are available for these garden areas in the interests of the residents of the development and the visual and general amenities of the locality in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan' Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The tree protection measures for both trees on and off site shall be in place prior to the commencement of any work within the relevant phase of the development in accordance with the approved details and these works shall not be removed until the completion of the relevant phase of the development. The areas so enclosed shall not be used for any purpose and the soil levels shall not be altered.

Reason: To safeguard the future of these trees that contribute towards the visual amenity and character of the area in accordance with policy 4.5 of the council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines' | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the boundary to the railway, school and community building approved under ref: P/2011/1024 dated 02/03/2012, P/2013/1858 dated 02/07/2013, and 165109CND dated 09/11/2016.

Reason: In the interests of the visual amenity and character of the locality and the safety of the occupants and visitors to this development in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4, 4.6, 4.7, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the children's play spaces approved under ref: P/2010/3065 dated 11/07/2011, P/2013/1625 dated 30/09/2014, P/2014/3881 dated 26/09/2014, and P/2015/1676 dated 22/05/2015. The approved detail shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of not more than 90% of the residential units within that phase of the development and these facilities shall thereafter be retained and maintained in a usable and workable condition.

Reason: To ensure adequate suitable children's play areas are provided and retained in conjunction with this development in the interests of the prospective occupiers of the development and in accordance with policy 3.5 of the council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the layout of the public car parking and cycle/motorcycle parking, including the number/location of disabled parking spaces including a Safety Audit approved under ref: P/2010/1279 dated 15/06/2012. The spaces as approved shall all be marked out, provided with the associated access and manoeuvring space and available for use prior to the first occupation of any of the retail shops, or in accordance with a phasing programme agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority and these spaces shall thereafter only be available for use by the public and shall not be obstructed or used for any other purpose, except with the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure adequate parking, including disabled parking, is provided and retained in the interests of the retail attractiveness of the Ealing Broadway Centre and in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of general highway safety on the neighbouring highways in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3, 7.1 and 9.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the details submitted with the application; details of the layout of the residents car parking and cycle/motorcycle, including the number/location of disabled parking spaces including a Safety Audit, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The spaces as approved shall be marked out, provided with the associated access and manoeuvring space and available for use prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units they are to serve, or in accordance with a phasing programme agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure adequate parking is provided and retained for the residents in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of general highway safety on neighbouring highways in accordance with policies 6.3, 6.11, 6.12 and 6.13 of the London Plan 2016 and policy 6.13 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013. | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the layout of the servicing areas and associated access and manoeuvring areas including a Safety Audit approved under ref: P/2010/1281 dated 13/01/2011, and P/2011/4631 dated 15/06/2012. The servicing areas as approved shall be provided and available for use prior to the first occupation  of any of the retail and other commercial units hereby permitted and permanently  retained and shall not be obstructed or used for any other purpose except with the  prior permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a  planning application.

Reason: To ensure adequate servicing is provided and retained for the retail and commercial units within the development in the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of general highway safety on the neighbouring highways in accordance with policy 9.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the Car Park and 'Servicing Management Plan' approved under ref: P/2010/3066 dated 23/12/2010.

Reason: In the interests of the free flow of traffic and conditions of general highway safety on the neighbouring highways, the amenities of occupiers of properties within the vicinity of the site and in the interests of security within the site in accordance with policies 4.4 and 9.1 in the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the phasing, laying out and lighting of the pedestrian accesses across the site including a Safety Audit approved under ref: P/2011/4087 dated 08/06/2012. The approved accesses shall be completed in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of any of the commercial or residential units within the relevant phase of the development that is served by the access route. Subsequently the access shall not be obstructed in part or whole (except for the purposes of emergency services repairs), unless the prior written permission of the local planning authority has been obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure suitable and safe pedestrian access is provided and retained in conjunction with the development and for those passing through the site in pursuance of policies 9.1 and 9.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the cycle parking facilities proposed for use by the public approved under ref: P/2010/1282 dated 20/07/2012. These facilities serve and shall be provided as part of the relevant phase prior to the occupation of any of the retail or commercial units within that phase, or such other time as may be agreed in writing with the local planning authority and thereafter these facilities shall not be removed except with the prior permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking for shoppers and visitors to the development and Ealing Metropolitan Centre is provided and retained in pursuance of policy 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the cycle parking facilities proposed for the occupiers of the residential units and their visitors approved under ref: P/2011/4397 dated 18/07/2012. The facilities shall be provided prior to the occupation of any residential unit within the phase of the development that the cycle parking facilities are to serve, or such other time as may be agreed in writing with the local planning authority and thereafter these facilities shall not be removed except with the prior permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure adequate cycle parking for the residents and visitors to the development and Ealing Metropolitan Centre is provided and retained in pursuance of policy 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the cycle parking facilities and associated changing facilities proposed for use by staff employed in premises on the site approved under ref: P/2013/1541 dated 18/06/2013.

Reason : To ensure adequate cycle parking and changing facilities for people employed within the development  is provided and retained in pursuance of policy 9.6 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the affordable housing 'Phasing Programme' approved under ref: P/2011/0197 dated 14/03/2011.

Reason : To ensure the provision of a suitable mix of housing tenure within the development in accordance with policy 5.2 in the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'(2004) and Supplementary Planning Document 1 'Affordable Housing'. | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the lifetime home compliance documents approved under ref: P/2011/3586 dated 27/09/2011, P/2014/1959 dated 11/06/2014, P/2014/5104 dated 21/04/2015, and P/2015/2784 dated 06/08/2015. The details shall be implemented as approved prior to first occupation of each dwelling. This condition applies notwithstanding the details submitted with the application.

Reason: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the 'wheelchair accessible' units which shall constitute 10% of all the dwellings approved under ref: P/2011/3587 dated 27/09/2011, P/2011/4531 dated 21/11/2011, P/2014/5106 dated 27/11/2014, and P/2015/1809 dated 06/07/2015.

Reason: To ensure suitable accommodation for disabled persons, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.3 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | All residential units hereby approved shall be designed to achieve at least 'Level 3 of the Code for Sustainable Homes'.

Reason: To ensure a sustainable living environment is secured; in accordance with policies 2.1, and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The refuse and recycling storage areas indicated on the submitted drawings shall be completed and available for use for each phase of development prior to the first occupation of any of the residential, or retail units within that phase of development and these facilities shall not thereafter be obstructed or used for any other purpose except with the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure appropriate refuse and recycling facilities are provided and retained in the interests of the amenities of the occupiers of the proposed development and the visual and general amenities of the locality and in pursuance of policy 2.10 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment'(2004). | The community building hereby permitted shall only be used for the following purposes and for no other use including any other use within Use Classes D1 and D2 of the Schedule attached to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification:  i)	a crèche, day nursery or day centre; ii)	for the provision of education; iii)	for the display of works of art (otherwise than for sale or hire);  iv)	a museum; v)	a public hall, a parish hall or exhibition hall; vi)	a dance hall or a gymnasium; vii)	for indoor sports and recreation.

Reason: To provide a suitable range of uses for this replacement community building within the Ealing Metropolitan Centre in the interests of the public and residents and to provide complementary uses to the adjacent school and listed church within the Ealing Town Centre Conservation Area in pursuance of policies 4.8, 4.11, 7.1, 7.7 8.1, 8.6 and 8.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The health spa shall only be occupied and used for that purpose only and for no other use within Use Class D2 of the Schedule attached to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or in any provision equivalent to that Class in any statutory instrument revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: To enable the local planning authority to maintain control over the use of these premises in the interests of function and vitality of the Ealing Metropolitan Centre in pursuance of policies 4.11, 7.1, 7.6 and 7.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the programme of archaeological work and written scheme for investigation approved under ref: P/2010/3154 dated 21/10/2010. The archaeological works shall be carried out by a suitably qualified investigating body acceptable to the local planning authority.

Reason: Important archaeological remains may exist on site and the local planning authority wishes to record them prior to development in pursuance of policy 4.9 in the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the security measures to be incorporated into the detailed design and layout of the buildings, car parking areas, vehicle servicing areas, vehicular access, cycle parking areas, refuse and recycling storage areas, footpaths and areas of public realm approved under ref: P/2010/1283 dated 07/10/2010, P/2014/6157 dated 23/11/2009, P/2015/0657 dated 13/04/2015, and 164995VAR dated 20/01/2017. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of that phase of the development.

Reason: In the interests of the safety of occupiers of the accommodation on site and the users and visitors to the development in pursuance of policy 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 8 'Safer Ealing'. | The development shall be completed in accordance with the suitable measures for access by disabled persons to, from and within buildings and across the relevant part of the site approved under ref: P/2014/2760 dated 22/07/2014. The approved details shall thereafter be maintained.

Reason: To provide and retain suitable disabled access within the development  in pursuance of policy 4.3 in the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the Travel Plans approved under ref: P/2011/3658 dated 13/08/2012, P/2014/3039 dated 27/10/2014, P/2015/0676 dated 09/06/2016, and 171928CND dated 27/04/2017. The approved Travel Plans shall be implemented prior to occupation of that phase of the development.

Reason: To ensure that access to the development is maximised and inclusive and reduces reliance on the use of the car in accordance with policies 9.1, 9.4, 9.5, 9.6, 9.7 and 9.8 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).

| The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the 'Demolition Construction Strategy' approved under ref: P/2010/0764 dated 01/02/2011, P/2010/3598 dated 06/10/2010, P/2013/2193 dated 11/12/2015, P/2014/5882 dated 31/03/2015, P/2015/1477 dated 11/12/2015, and 165724CND dated 13/02/2017. The demolition and construction shall be carried out only in accordance with the approved Strategy.

Reason: In the interests of the minimising the impact of noise, vibration and airborne pollution on the amenities of occupiers of properties within the vicinity of the site, to limit the works to reasonable hours and to minimise the impact of the traffic on the highway network for the duration of the redevelopment of the site in pursuance of policies 2.6, 2.10 4.1 , 9.1, 9.9 and 9.10 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).

| Arrangements shall be put in place throughout the duration of the building works to clean the wheels of vehicles leaving the site and to ensure the security of any loads being removed from the site. These measures shall be put into effect on each vehicle leaving the site.

Reason: To prevent the spread of mud, dirt and debris on the adjoining roads, in the interests of highway safety in accordance with policy 4.1 of the Council's adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the scheme for protecting sensitive rooms from external noise approved under ref: P/2010/0990 dated 10/08/2010. No dwellings shall be occupied if it is demonstrated that the approved tests are not met.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of residential accommodation within the development in pursuance of policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the suitable and appropriate construction of buildings approved under ref: P/2010/3160 dated P/2008/0156.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of residential accommodation within the development in pursuance of policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
| The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the noise level emitted from the plant and machinery approved under ref: P/2010/3067 dated 08/10/2010.

Reason:  To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties in pursuance of policy 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Development'. | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the installation, operation, and maintenance of the best practicable odour abatement equipment including an extract system, the height of the discharge, and the efflux velocity of the effluent at the point of discharge approved under ref: P/2010/0996 dated 20/07/2010.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of residential accommodation within the development in pursuance of policy 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the sound reduction index of the external building envelope approved under ref: P/2010/1546 dated 08/10/2010.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of residential accommodation within the development in pursuance of policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the sound limiting device to control the output from the amplification system to a maximum noise level approved under ref: P/2010/1530 dated 08/10/2010.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of residential accommodation within the development in pursuance of policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the mechanical ventilation system approved under ref: P/2010/0511 dated 31/03/2010.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of residential accommodation within the development in pursuance of policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Activities involving emission of amplified music and speech shall be restricted to the period of 0600-2300 hrs on any day.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of residential accommodation within the development in pursuance of policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013. | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the sound reduction index of the separating party (floor/ceilings and walls) and external envelope for the proposed Health Spa (Class D2 Use) approved under ref: P/2010/1284 dated 06/08/2010.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the residential accommodation within the development in accordance with policies 4.11 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the method statement demonstrating compliance with the London Councils/Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition' approved under ref: P/2010/0769 dated 05/09/2011, P/2010/3599 dated 08/10/2010, P/2013/2192 dated 26/07/2013, P/2014/6183 dated 27/01/2015, P/2015/1656 dated 22/05/2015, and 165110CND dated 11/11/2016.

Reason : To safeguard the environment and amenities of occupiers of properties within the vicinity of the site in pursuance of policy 2.6 in the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary planning Guidance 3 'Air Quality and Pollution'. | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the method statement demonstrating compliance with the provisions of BS5228, Code of Practice for the Control of Noise from Construction and Open Sites approved under ref: P/2010/0771 dated 03/02/2011, P/2010/3600 dated 08/10/2010, PP/2013/2215 dated 31/07/2013, P/2014/6185 dated 10/09/2015, P/2015/1657 dated 10/09/2015, and 165118CND dated 11/11/2016.

Reason: In the interests of the minimising the impact of noise, vibration and airborne pollution on the amenities of occupiers of properties within the vicinity of the site, to limit the works to reasonable hours and to minimise the impact of the traffic on the highway network for the duration of the redevelopment of the site in accordance with policies 2.6, 2.10, 4.1, 5.5, 9.1, 9.9 and 9.10 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Access to and from the site for commercial vehicles involved in the demolition of the existing buildings and construction of the new buildings and the associated works shall not take place between 08-00 and 09-15 and 15-00 and 16-30 on any weekday.

Reason: In the interests of safety of pedestrians and other road users in pursuance of policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the external lighting of the building and spillage mitigation measures approved under ref: P/2011/4092 dated 15/11/2011, PP/2013/4964 dated 06/01/2014, P/2014/6158 dated 22/02/2015, and P/2015/2333 dated 13/07/2015. The details shall be permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To protect the character and nature of the area and to safeguard the amenities of occupiers of neighbouring residential properties and the occupiers of residential properties within the development, in accordance with policy 4.12 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004. | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the removal of contaminated soil, and Remediation Strategy and Validation Scheme approved under ref: P/2010/3601 dated 07/10/2010.

Reason: To protect health and safety of occupants of the development and users of this and neighbouring sites and to prevent pollution of the water environment, in accordance with policies 2.7 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (Plan for the Environment) 2004. | There shall be no more than 4,000sqm of café/restaurant floor space (use class A3), 400sqm of drinking establishments (use class A4) and 2,600sqm of health spa (use class D2) floor space within the development.

Reason: To ensure the new shopping frontages enhance the vitality and viability of Ealing Town Centre in accordance with policies 4B and 4C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013. | No more than 3,000m2 of gross retail floor space within the development shall be used for convenience shopping; unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: In the interests of ensuring the continuing viability of Ealing Town Centre in accordance with policies 7.1 and 7.2 of the Council's Adopted UDP 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to first occupation of each phase of the development a drawing confirming the size, layout and location of the retail (Class A1) units, the café/restaurants (Class A3) units, the drinking establishment units (Class A4), the Health Spa (Class D2) uses and the office (Class B1) use, within the development, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and thereafter retained as approved, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The first use of each of the ground floor units shall thereafter be the lawful use of that unit.

Reason: To ensure the new shopping frontages enhance the vitality and viability of Ealing Town Centre; in accordance with policies 4B and 4C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013. | Before first occupation of the Health Spa (Class D2) unit within the development, details of the management arrangements for the Health Spa (Class D2) use, including non-resident membership, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of the Health Spa (Class D2) use and thereafter maintained.

Reason: To ensure the Health Spa (Class D2) facility is available for public access at appropriate times; in accordance with policies 4.3 and 8.4 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be completed in accordance with the details of the design strategy for all of the shopping frontages approved under ref: P/2011/3590 dated 31/07/2012.

Reason: To ensure the new shopping frontages enhance the vitality and viability of Ealing Town Centre, and achieve a coherent design appearance for this Conservation Area development; in accordance with policies 7.1, 7.3, 4.1 and 4.8 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A shop window display shall be maintained at all times in all the retail (Class A1) units hereby approved; and the shop windows shall not be obscured in any way.

Reason: To maintain the continuity and interest of the shopping frontages, in accordance with policies 7.1, and 7.3 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 1995 (or any Order revoking or re-enacting this Order) no change of use shall be undertaken to Class A2 (Financial and Professional Services).
Reason: To protect the hierarchy of shopping frontages in
